plugins.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
plugins.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
138970.release_notes: The preview feature has been improved to allow users to review the extracted styles and color results directly in the plugin popup.
138970.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

plugins.name: Syntax Manager
plugins.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes – done!
plugins.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

  6. Apply your changes – done!
130750.release_notes:
New Features:
- Inline syntax editing – Click directly on syntax values to edit them instantly.
- Prefix dropdown – Choose how templates are applied: Auto, Name, or Syntax mode.
- Multiple replacements – Use ; to apply several find/replace patterns in one step.

Enhancements:
- UI improvements for better clarity and usability
- Various bug fixes for a smoother, more reliable experience
130750.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

plugins.name: Prism by lumos
plugins.description:
🌈 Prism by Lumos


A smarter way to manage your Figma color variables


Prism is a powerful, easy-to-use plugin built to help you create, organize, and maintain a clean, scalable color system in Figma. Whether you’re building from scratch or refining an existing system, Prism takes the heavy lifting out of color management.


It’s the same powerful tool we use to power the Lumos Design System — with token-based color management built right in.


⸻


✨ What Prism does best

•🎨 Full Color System

Instantly generate a complete color palette (from 50 to 900) based on your base colors.

•🔗 Semantic Color Mapping

Create semantic color variables that stay linked to your base palette.

•🌗 Light & Dark Theme Support

Effortlessly manage color values for both light and dark modes.

•🧰 Visual Color Editor

Tweak colors visually with a real-time preview — no guesswork required.

•📁 Clean, Organized Structure

Keeps your color variables tidy and consistent with logical naming and folders.

•🧩 Built for Design Tokens

Prism follows a token-based approach inspired by the Lumos Design System, making it easy to plug into any design system workflow.


⸻


Prism helps you focus on what matters — great design — by handling the complexity of color systems behind the scenes. Perfect for design systems, large projects, or anyone who wants a more organized Figma file.
plugins.tagline: Color token management designed to power the Lumos Design System.

plugins.description:
Who even has the time to name every rectangles, right?


🎦 See How it Works


TagScout is here to boost your Figma workflow so you can focus on what really matters.


With TagScout, you can:


🏷️ Tag anything:

Add custom tags to frames, layers, or groups for quick reference.


🔍 Find instantly:

Search and jump to any tagged element in seconds, even across pages.


🚀 Stay organised:

Keep your files tidy and your workflow efficient, no matter how complex the project.


Stop wasting time scrolling and start designing smarter. TagScout helps you save hours and keep your creative flow intact.


Try it now and see the difference!

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Frames by Names
plugins.description:
Frames by Names is your new Figma sidekick!


Tired of manually creating and naming frames one by one? Just paste in your list of names, pick your desired frame size and letter case style (or keep it original), and watch as your canvas magically fills with neatly organized frames right where you're looking.


Whether you're brainstorming, organizing, or just having fun with names, this plugin makes design setup quick and playful. Say hello to effortless layouts and goodbye to tedious frame creation—let Frames by Names bring order (and a dash of whimsy) to your Figma workflow!

accepted.name: Pragmatics Studio
accepted.description: We believe that design is most beautiful when it works. We’re here to co-create and empower your team with design and creative problem solving.

plugins.tagline: Paste a list of names, choose the frame size, and watch frames appear in view.

Whether you're brainstorming, organizing, or just having fun with names, this plugin makes design setup quick and playful. Say hello to effortless layouts and goodbye to tedious frame creation—let Frames by Names bring order (and a dash of whimsy) to your Figma workflow!

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
117679.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

  3. Use the HTML banner wherever you want


Why pay lots of money for other tools when you can just Fig2Ad.

plugins.name: CDS Figma Converter
plugins.description: 此插件旨在帮助设计师和开发者快速高效地将 Figma 中的设计内容无缝迁移到我们的内部系统 CDS（Content Delivery System）。通过简单易用的操作界面，您可以轻松导出设计文件、组件和图层，并确保所有数据在 CDS 中正确存储和管理，从而提高工作流程的效率，减少重复劳动。适用于需要在多平台间协同工作的团队，助力项目的快速迭代和交付。
plugins.tagline: 连接Figma和高途CDS的助手。

plugins.name: Corners Alignment
plugins.description:
主要功能


1. 多矩形圆角对齐

选中多个矩形时：

▸ 自动取最大矩形为基准

▸ 同步小矩形圆角弧度，实现视觉边距等距效果

▸ 非等比例对齐时，按最小间距自动计算


2. 容器内元素圆角对齐

选中 Frame/组件/实例时：

▸ 自动识别为容器

▸ 调整所有首层子元素（矩形/Frame等）的圆角


Main Features


1. Multi-Rectangle Corner Alignment

On selecting multiple rectangles:

▸ Takes largest rectangle as reference

▸ Syncs smaller rectangles' corners for visual equidistance

▸ Uses min-spacing calculation for non-proportional alignment


2. Container Element Alignment

On selecting Frame/Component/Instance:

▸ Identifies as container

▸ Adjusts corners of all top-level child elements
plugins.tagline: 对齐嵌套圆角 Align nested corners

136753.name: Corners Alignment
136753.description:
主要功能


1. 多矩形圆角对齐

选中多个矩形时：

▸ 自动取最大矩形为基准

▸ 同步小矩形圆角弧度，实现视觉边距等距效果

▸ 非等比例对齐时，按最小间距自动计算


2. 容器内元素圆角对齐

选中 Frame/组件/实例时：

▸ 自动识别为容器

▸ 调整所有首层子元素（矩形/Frame等）的圆角


Main Features


1. Multi-Rectangle Corner Alignment

On selecting multiple rectangles:

▸ Takes largest rectangle as reference

▸ Syncs smaller rectangles' corners for visual equidistance

▸ Uses min-spacing calculation for non-proportional alignment


2. Container Element Alignment

On selecting Frame/Component/Instance:

▸ Identifies as container

▸ Adjusts corners of all top-level child elements
136753.release_notes:
增加了ui界面，新增了最小圆角值和平滑圆角值设置，新增了邻近角对齐模式(适用于九宫格之类的网格自动布局)。
Added UI interface, added minimum corner radius and smooth corner radius settings, added adjacent corner alignment mode (suitable for grid automatic layouts such as 3x3 grids).
136753.tagline: 对齐嵌套圆角 Align nested corners

plugins.name: Fieldnotes
plugins.description:
Fieldnotes transforms in-person workshop sticky notes into digital boards.


Simply take photos of your sticky notes using your phone (you just have to scan a QR code to sync) or upload images directly to the plugin. Your physical sticky notes are instantly recreated in your board, preserving the texts, colors, position, and all your ideas :)


Fieldnotes combines several AI recognition technologies to boost accuracy and to detect even messy handwriting across multiple languages.

Pro users gain access to powerful AI-enhanced features including text improvement, grammar correction, and automatic workshop summaries.


Transform raw workshop notes into polished, actionable content and generate comprehensive takeaways to share with stakeholders, a dream follow-up!


If you want to learn more about the plugin or simply because you are passionate about Product or collaboration, feel free to reach out
plugins.tagline: Fieldnotes transforms pictures of sticky notes into stickies — ready to share, without the hassle

plugins.name: FigFlight - Add Real Airport Info, Instantly
plugins.description:
FigFlight – Add Real Airport Info, Instantly


Explore global airports by continent, country, and city — then instantly write localized airport details into your selected Figma text layers!


🌍 Supports 5 languages: 🇬🇧English, 🇹🇷Turkish, 🇩🇪German, 🇷🇺Russian, 🇸🇦Arabic

🔎 Filter by continent, country and city

🎲 Random airport picker

✍️ Copy country, city, airport name or code directly to your design


Ideal for travel-related designs, localization work, or geographic data visualization.


☕️ Buy me a coffee
plugins.tagline: Insert multilingual airport data into Figma—fast, filtered and fully localized. ✈️

plugins.name: Find & Replace Anything
plugins.description:
Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!


A powerful tool for finding and replacing styles! Works with components, instances and library styles. Especially helpful to align parameters across projects in bulk like auto layout or library styles for your pixel perfect design.


Plugin is in active development. Therefore, any feedback is appreciated! Like our plugin? Leave a heart!


Full feature list:


Library & local Styles

  1. Fonts
  2. Colors
  3. Effects
  4. Grids


Variables (search only)

  1. Color Variable
  2. Number Variable
  3. String Variable
  4. Boolean Variable


Shape & Frame

  1. Name
  2. Width
  3. Height
  4. Position X
  5. Position Y
  6. Rotation
  7. Constrain Proportions
  8. Clip content


Text

  1. Text
  2. Font Size
  3. Paragraphs Spacing
  4. Paragraph Indent
  5. Text Decoration
  6. Text Case
  7. Text Resizing
  8. Text Align Horizontal
  9. Text Align Vertical


Layer

  1. Blend Mode
  2. Opacity
  3. Visibility


Stroke

  1. Stroke Align
  2. Stroke Weight
  3. Stroke Join


Auto Layout

  1. Layout mode
  2. Spacing between items
  3. Paddings
plugins.tagline: Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!

plugins.name: Asset Dependencies
plugins.description:
Effortlessly manage and visualize your Figma assets with the Asset Dependencies plugin. This powerful tool scans and analyzes your local Figma files, creating a topologically sorted list of all components, subcomponents, dependencies, and usage.


Comprehensive analysis

Automatically scans your Figma assets to identify all components and their relationships.


Topological sorting

Generates a clear, topologically sorted list of components and subcomponents, making it easy to understand dependencies.


Dependency mapping

Visualize which components are used by others, helping you manage and optimize your design system.


Usage insights

See at a glance how and where each component is used across your file.


Export options

Export lists as CSV files to use in other tools.

accepted.name: Elgato
accepted.description: Stream. Record. Create. | Empowering content creators since 2012

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

110619.description:

plugins.name: Move Outside
plugins.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the page’s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
plugins.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

106901.name: Move Outside
106901.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:

  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.

plugins.name: Yet Another Design Linter
plugins.description:
✨ Yet Another Design Linter (YADL): Your Design System's Enforcer

YADL is the essential Figma plugin for teams who care about consistency, scalability, and design system integrity. Automate linting, enforce variable use, and ship cleaner designs—fast.


🚀 Why use it?

Design systems aren't just style guides—they're contracts. YADL automates enforcing those contracts so you're not stuck playing pixel cop.


🔍 What it does:

• Variable-Aware Linting + Auto-Fix: Instantly checks padding, gap, radius, stroke width, fills, strokes, effects, and typography—flags rogue values and suggests or auto-applies matching design tokens.


• Smart Error Grouping: See issues grouped by type and value with intelligent prioritization; focus on what matters most.


• Typography Linting: Comprehensive checks for font family, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing consistency.


• Deleted Variable Detection: Identifies broken variable references and optionally auto-detaches them to prevent errors.


• Component Structure Analysis: Detects nested components that may cause performance issues.


• Accessibility Checks: Flags common a11y pitfalls for inclusive design.


• Flexible Layer Filtering: Configurable options to include/exclude hidden or locked layers.


• Strict Linting Mode: Enhanced validation rules for production-ready designs.


• Variable Collection Control: Choose which variable collections to include in suggestions.


• Persistent UI State: Remembers window size and settings for smoother workflow.


• Precise Value Suggestions: See exact px values next to each suggestion—no guessing.


• Resizable, Accessible UI: Resize handle + full keyboard navigation for better UX.


🚦 It detects:

✅ Generic layer names (e.g., "Frame 1", "Rectangle 2")

✅ Absolute positioning inside auto layout

✅ All padding types (left, right, top, bottom, horizontal, vertical) not using variables

✅ Gap, border radius, stroke width not using variables

✅ Fill colors, stroke colors, effects not using variables

✅ Typography properties (font family, size, weight, line height, letter spacing) not using variables

✅ Broken variable references from deleted design tokens

✅ Nested components causing potential performance issues

✅ Issues in hidden or locked layers (configurable)


🎨 How it works:

1. Run the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Review errors categorized by type (Core Design, Spacing & Layout, Visual Properties, Typography, Variable Management, Component Structure).

3. Apply auto-suggestions with one click or fix issues manually.

4. Configure settings to match your team's workflow and design system.


💡 Who it's for:

• Designers who care about clean, token-driven files

• Teams enforcing scalable, maintainable design systems

• Design system managers ensuring consistency across projects

• Developers who need structured, handoff-ready designs

• Teams transitioning to variable-based design workflows


🎯 Perfect for:

• Design system audits and cleanup

• Onboarding new team members to design standards

• Pre-handoff quality checks

• Maintaining design token consistency at scale


Made with ❤️ for the Adtraction design team by Jonatan D. Bjerrekær.


YADL: Keep your Figma files clean, scalable, and system-perfect—automatically.
plugins.tagline: Keep your Figma files clean, consistent, and design-system perfect—automatically.

138051.name: Yet Another Design Linter
138051.description:
✨ Yet Another Design Linter (YADL): Your Design System's Enforcer

YADL is the essential Figma plugin for teams who care about consistency, scalability, and design system integrity. Automate linting, enforce variable use, and ship cleaner designs—fast.

🔍 What it does:

YADL: Keep your Figma files clean, scalable, and system-perfect—automatically.
138051.release_notes:
Enhance variable resolution and introduce new preview components

- Refactor the VariableCollectionService to improve variable alias resolution, implementing a recursive function to handle circular references and ensure accurate value retrieval.
- Introduce new preview components for various design properties, including ColorPreview, TypographyPreview, EffectsPreview, OpacityPreview, RadiusPreview, SpacingPreview, and StrokePreview, enhancing the visual representation of design variables.
- Update the StyleList and VariableList components to utilize the new preview components, improving the user experience by providing clear visual feedback for different variable types.
- Enhance CSS styles for the new preview components, ensuring consistency and responsiveness across different screen sizes.
- Implement additional props in relevant components to support remote and local variable indications, improving clarity for users regarding variable origins.
138051.tagline: Keep your Figma files clean, consistent, and design-system perfect—automatically.

plugins.name: Frames to Auto Layout
plugins.description:
We’ve all done it–selected multiple frames and tried to add auto layout to each of them, only to find that instead of adding auto layout to every frame individually as expected, Figma annoyingly groups all your selected frames and organizes them in a single auto layout.


This simple plugin provides that missing, expected functionality for Figma. With this plugin, simply select all of the frames you want to add auto layout to and run the plugin, and voila—every frame you selected will now have auto layout added, instead of the default Figma behavior of grouping the selected frames within a new frame and organizing your selected layers in a single auto layout—so annoying!


Currently the plugin simply sets the same default auto layout properties that the standard "add auto layout" UI button and command add—horizontal directionality and 10px padding and spacing. I may consider adding to this plugin the ability to configure custom default properties with a separate command—please comment if such a feature would interest you.

accepted.name: Avana Vana
accepted.description:
Senior Product Designer & Full-stack Developer

Currently Design Lead at Co:Create (www.cocreate.ink)

plugins.tagline: Add auto layout to multiple frames individually, instantly.

129400.tagline: Add auto layout to multiple frames individually, instantly.

plugins.name: RTL智能适配助手 RTL Auto Adapt Helper
plugins.description:
介绍

本插件可帮助设计师一键启用或关闭组件的“阿语”属性，用于快速适配阿拉伯语等 RTL（从右至左）语言界面。支持自动识别并批量设置所选节点及其子组件的变量值，提高国际化效率。


功能说明

  1. 自动查找所选组件中的“阿语”变量属性
  2. 一键切换阿语属性值为 on 或 off
  3. 实时统计处理成功和失败的组件数量
  4. 支持递归处理嵌套结构与实例组件


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 中选中一个或多个组件或画板
  2. 打开插件界面
  3. 点击“启用阿语模式”或“关闭阿语模式”按钮
  4. 查看统计信息，确认处理结果


注意事项

  1. 插件仅处理存在“阿语”变量属性的组件
  2. 若组件未设置该属性，将不会被修改
  3. 暂不支持自动创建属性，请先在组件中配置好“阿语”变量


Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click “Enable Arabic Mode” or “Disable Arabic Mode”
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties — please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Smart Arabic mode toggle for RTL-friendly components

136438.name: RTL智能适配助手 RTL Auto Adapt Helper
136438.description:
介绍

本插件可帮助设计师一键启用或关闭组件的“阿语”属性，用于快速适配阿拉伯语等 RTL（从右至左）语言界面。支持自动识别并批量设置所选节点及其子组件的变量值，提高国际化效率。


功能说明

  1. 自动查找所选组件中的“阿语”变量属性
  2. 一键切换阿语属性值为 on 或 off
  3. 实时统计处理成功和失败的组件数量
  4. 支持递归处理嵌套结构与实例组件


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 中选中一个或多个组件或画板
  2. 打开插件界面
  3. 点击“启用阿语模式”或“关闭阿语模式”按钮
  4. 查看统计信息，确认处理结果


注意事项

  1. 插件仅处理存在“阿语”变量属性的组件
  2. 若组件未设置该属性，将不会被修改
  3. 暂不支持自动创建属性，请先在组件中配置好“阿语”变量


Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click “Enable Arabic Mode” or “Disable Arabic Mode”
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties — please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

manifest.name: RTL智能适配助手 RTL Auto Adapt Helper

136438.release_notes: Update the cover and add a usage demo video
136438.tagline: Smart Arabic mode toggle for RTL-friendly components

plugins.name: Simple inspector
plugins.description:
CSS Extractor is a Figma plugin designed to help developers quickly extract CSS styles from selected elements and their children. It supports nested structures, text styles, image fills, and allows for easy image export. The UI provides options to copy the entire style block or individual style lines.


Key Features:


🔍 Display of selected elements and their child hierarchy.


🎨 Conversion of styles to CSS with unit selection: px or rem.


📋 Copy full CSS blocks or individual lines.


🖼 Export image fills directly from elements.
plugins.tagline: Simple inspector css style copy and export source image

127969.name: Simple inspector
127969.description:

127969.tagline: Simple inspector css style copy and export source image

plugins.name: QR Code Generator
plugins.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they don’t rely on our service and they’re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.
plugins.tagline: Create QR codes without leaving Figma

126163.name: QR Code Generator
126163.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they don’t rely on our service and they’re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin requires network access to RecodeQR's API to generate QR codes. No user data is stored.

126163.release_notes: Fixed dark mode, improve community details
126163.tagline: Create QR codes without leaving Figma

plugins.name: SPLOC - Selected the parent of component layer
plugins.description:
A plugin for Figma that automatically selects the parent component when any child within the component or its instance is selected.


Main features:

  1. Automatic detection and selection of the parent component
  2. Automatic collapse of the selected component
  3. On/Off switch to enable/disable functionality
  4. Memories the last selection to prevent cyclic selections


How to use:

  1. Install the plugin
  2. Launch the plugin (it is active by default)
  3. Select any element within the component or its instance
  4. The plugin will automatically:
  5. Finds the parent component
  6. Select it
  7. Flattens the structure of the component


Interface:

  1. Compact window with ON/OFF switch
  2. The switch allows you to temporarily disable plugin functionality


Technical features:

  1. Works with components (COMPONENT) and their instances (INSTANCE)
  2. Prevents cyclic selections
  3. Optimized for working with large files
  4. Minimal impact on Figma performance


Application:

Ideal for working with large component systems where switching between children and parent components is often required.


----------------------------------------



Плагин для Figma, который автоматически выделяет родительский компонент при выборе любого дочернего элемента внутри компонента или его экземпляра.


Основные возможности:

  1. Автоматическое определение и выбор родительского компонента
  2. Автоматическое схлопывание (collapse) выбранного компонента
  3. Переключатель On/Off для включения/отключения функционала
  4. Запоминание последнего выбора для предотвращения циклических выделений


Как использовать:

  1. Установите плагин
  2. Запустите плагин (он активен по умолчанию)
  3. Выберите любой элемент внутри компонента или его экземпляра
  4. Плагин автоматически:
  5. Найдет родительский компонент
  6. Выделит его
  7. Схлопнет структуру компонента


Интерфейс:

  1. Компактное окно с переключателем ON/OFF
  2. Переключатель позволяет временно отключить функционал плагина


Технические особенности:

  1. Работает с компонентами (COMPONENT) и их экземплярами (INSTANCE)
  2. Предотвращает циклические выделения
  3. Оптимизирован для работы с большими файлами
  4. Минимальное влияние на производительность Figma


Применение:

Идеально подходит для работы с большими компонентными системами, где часто требуется переключение между дочерними элементами и родительскими компонентами.
plugins.tagline: Automatically selects parent component when child layer is selected

plugins.name: Revelio
plugins.description: This plugin will automatically select all the hidden layers within current selection and will unhide all of them. You can also highlight the revealed layers.
plugins.tagline: Unhide the hidden layers in your design file

117706.name: Revelio
117706.description: This plugin will automatically select all the hidden layers within current selection and will unhide all of them. You can also highlight the revealed layers.
117706.tagline: Unhide the hidden layers in your design file

plugins.name: DesignBoost
plugins.description:
Plugin Description

This Figma plugin integrates with Qingmu Gallery, allowing users to access and utilize its extensive image database directly within Figma. Users can search and filter images based on tags and names. The plugin displays a list of matching images, and with a simple click, users can place and edit the images in their Figma projects.
plugins.tagline: DesignBoost

135596.name: DesignBoost
135596.description:
